alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 1:50AM MST until March 22 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MST/8 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Dry Beaver Creek, Wet Beaver Creek, and West Clear Creek in Yavapai and Coconino counties. * WHEN...Until 700 PM MST Wednesday /800 PM MDT Wednesday/. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks and streams is occurring with further rises in the water levels of already flooded creeks. Deadly flooding over low-water crossings is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 143 AM MST /243 AM MDT/, river guage reports indicated significant rises along Dry Beaver Creek, Wet Beaver Creek, and West Clear Creek due to heavy rain and snowmelt. Further rises are expected through this morning, with flooding already occurring. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Dry Beaver Creek, Wet Beaver Creek, and West Clear Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rimrock, Montezuma Well, Lake Montezuma, Mcguireville, Montezuma Castle National Monument, V Bar V Visitors Center, Wet Beaver Creek Campground and Clear Creek Campgrounds. - This includes the following swimming holes... Wet Beaver Creek Day Use Area, Bell Crossing "The Crack", Bull Pen Day Use Area, West Clear Creek near the campground, and Indian Maiden Falls. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
